۔ پاکستان لیزر کے شعبہ میں خاص مہارت رکھتا ہے, 
لیزر کی کئی خاصیتیں عام روشنی میں نہیں ہوتیں.  مثلاً انتہائ باریک شعاع جو لمبے فاصلے طے کرنے کے بعد بھی نہیں بکھرتی. 

اس خاص قسم کی روشنی کے کئ استعمال ہیں.  گرم لیزر سے دھات کاٹنا.  فاصلے ناپنا.  چیزوں کو ٹھنڈا کرنا. طب اور جراحی اس شعاع کے کئی استعمال میں سے چند ہیں, 
لیزر 1960 میں ایجا ہوئ اور صرف نو سال بعد 
پاکستان نے لیزر سے متعلق تحقیق کے میدان  میں 1969 میں قدم  رکھا. 
لاہور کے قریب ایک چھوٹی سی عمارت میں چند پاکستانی سائنسدانوں نے ملک کی پہلی لیزر شعاع پیدا کی. 
اسی زمانے میں اسلام آباد کے قریب "نیلور" کے نام سے ایک ایٹمی لیبارٹری بنائ گئ اور ادھر پاکستان کا پہلا ایٹمی ریاکٹر لگایا گیا. اسوقت کی حکومت کی پالیسی تھی کہ پاکستان میں سائنسی تحقیق کی بنیادیں مستحکم کیں جائیں. نیلور میں ایٹمی لیبارٹری کے ساتھ کئ اور لیبارٹریاں لگائ گئیں. انہی لیبارٹریوں میں سے ایک NILOP  کے نام سے قائم کی گئ جس کو لیزر اور روشنی کی سائنس کے تحقیقی آلات سے لیس کیا گیا. لاھور میں جو تحقیق شروع ہوئ تھی وہ یہاں منتقل ہو گئ. 
اسی سال مشرقی پاکستان یا موجودہ بنگلادیش میں بھی ایٹمی لیبارٹری قائم کی گئ تاکہ پاکستان کا وہ حصہ بھی سائنس کے میدان میں فاعل کردار ادا کرے. 
1971 میں بنگلادیش کے قیام کے بعد اُن کی ایٹمی تحقیق بند ہوئ مگر پاکستان نے ایٹم اور لیزر سمیت کئی شعبوں میں کام جاری رکھا. NILOP یا نیشنل انسٹی ٹیوٹ آف لیزر میں خوب تحقیق ہوئ. نئی دریافت شدہ لیزر کی سائنس پہ پاکستانی محققین کے مقالعے دنیا بھر کے سائنسی جرائد میں چھپے. یاد رہے کہ وہ آج کل کا زمانہ نہیں تھا جب ہر کسی کے چابی کے گچھے میں لیزر لٹکی ہوتی ہے- یہ ایک نئ اور نایاب طیز تھی جس پہ بہت کم ممالک تحقیق کر رہے تھے 
پاکستانیوں کی تحقیق کے چرچے ان سائنسدانوں تک گئے جنھوں نے لیزر ایجاد کی تھی اور 1976 میں نوبل انعام یافتہ ڈاکٹر الفریڈ کاسٹلر جو لیزر کے دنیا کے اولین محققین میں سے ایک تھے,وہ بھی پاکستانیوں کے اس شعبہ میں کام سے متاثر ہو کہ پاکستان آئے اور پاکستانی سائنسدانوں اور طلبا کو لیزر کے موجد سے سیکھنے کا موقع ملا . اسوقت لیزر کی تحقیق تھیوریٹیکل یا نظریاتی درجہ کا تھا. اس سارے کام سے پاکستانی سائنسدانوں کو ہر طرح کی لیزر کی خوب سمجھ بوجھ حاصل ہوئ.
دوسری طرف پاکستان کو مسلسل بھارت سے خطرہ رہا اور اپنے بچاؤ کی خاطر پاکستان کو فوجی ایٹمی پروگرام چلانا پڑا. 1976 میں ڈاکٹر عبدالقدیر خان کے زیر سرپرستی کہوٹہ ریسرچ لیبارٹری کا قیام عمل میں آیا. ادھر ڈاکٹر قدیر کی ڈیزائن کردہ centrifuge مشینیں لگائ گئیں جو خام یورانیم میں سے کارآمد یورانیم نکالتی ہیں. یہ مشینیں مختلف اقسام کے یورانیم کو الگ الگ کر کہ ایک قسم کا یورانیم ایٹمی بجلی گھروں کو اور دوسرے قسم کا ایٹم بم کے لیئے فراہم کرتی ہیں.
مگر چونکہ یہ مشینیں فی مشین  انتہائ کم مقدار میں یورانیم نکالتی ہیں اسلیئے کارآمد مقدار میں یورانیم حاصل کرنے کے لیئے ایسی کئ ھزار مشینیں ایک ہی جگہ پہ لگانی پڑتی ہیں. کہوٹہ کی تنصیب کئ ایکڑ رقبہ پہ محیط تھی اور ادھر ہزاروں سینٹری فیوج مشینیں یورانیم کشید کر رہی تھیں. 
مگر چونکہ کہوٹہ سے بھارت کا علاقہ دور نھیں اسلیئے اس انتہائ اہم تنصیب کا دفاع ہمیشہ افواج کے لیئے فکر کا موجب رہا.  اسی دوران 1981 میں اسرائیل نے آپریشن بابل کے نام سے عراقی ایٹمی تنصیبات پہ فضائ حملہ کر کہ انھیں تباہ کر دیا. 
پاکستانی جاسوسی اداروں کو خبر ملی کہ بھارت اب اسرائیل کے ساتھ مل کر پاکستان کی ایٹمی تنصیبات کو تباہ کرنے کا منصوبہ بنا رہا یے اور سر فہرست کہوٹہ ہے.  کیونکہ اگر کہوٹہ تباہ یو گیا تو پاکستان کے فوجی اور سویلین جوھری پروگرام کو یورانیم کی ترسیل بند ہو جائے گی. ایسا ہوا تو بھارت کی افواج کی عددی برتری اور روایتی ہتھیاروں کی برتری کے ساتھ ایٹمی ہتھیاروں کی برتری بھی حاصل ہو جاتی اور پاکستان کا دفاع انتھائ کمزور ہو جاتا. 
کہوٹہ کی تنصیبات اتنی بڑی تھیں کہ انھیں کہیں اور منتقل بھی نھیں کیا جا سکتا تھا. چنانچہ افواج پاکستان کو سرحدوں کا پہرہ کئ گنا بڑھانا پڑا. پاک فضا ئیہ کے جھاز پہلے سے کہیں زیادہ اڑان کرنے لگے تاکہ اگر حملہ ہوا تو فوراً حملہ آور جھازوں کا راستہ روکا جا سکے. 
پاکستان کے فوجی اور دفاعی منصوبہ بندی کرنے والوں کو اس بات کی  ضرورت شدت سے محسوس ہوئ کہ پاکستان کے یورانیم پیدا کرنے والی تنصیبات اگر کسی طرح چھوٹی کر دی جائیں تو مستقبل میں اس قسم کے خطرات کے دوران انھیں چھپانا یا دوسری جگہ منتقل کرنا ممکن ہو. 
پاکستان اٹامک انرجی کمیشن سے رابطہ کیا گیا. اور ان کے ذیلی ادارے NILOP جوکہ 1969 سے لیزر اور دوسرے بصریاتی سائنس پہ تحقیق کر رہے تھے,  انھوں نے کہا کہ ہم ایسا کر سکتے ہیں. 1981 کے بعد  کہوٹہ کے کئی ایکڑ پہ پھیلے سینٹری فیوج پہ مبنی یورانیم کشیدگی کی تنصیبات کو پیداواری صلاحیت کم کیئے بغیر چند کنٹینر وں کے حجم جتنا کرنے کا کام شروع ہوا. 
National institute of Laser optronics 
کے سائنسدانوں نے لیزر کے ذریعے یورانیم کشید کرنے کی خاص تکنیک پہ کام شروع کیا. اس سے پہلے اسی ادارے کے کچھ سائنسدان جو ادھر تحقیقاتی کام کی کمی کی وجہ سے باہر جا چکے تھے, انھیں اس نئے اور بڑے تحقیقاتی کام میں حصہ لینے واپس پاکستان بلایا گیا. اسلاماباد کے قریب موجود اس ادارے کا بجٹ بڑھایا گیا اور اسے وسعت دے کہ یہاں جدید آلات لگائے گئے. 
یورینیم کشیدگی کے نئے طریقہ پہ کام تیزی سے جاری رہا مگر اب پہلے سے زیادہ بڑی اور جدید لیزر لیبارٹری میں نئے اور جدید آلات نے کئی اور طرح کی غیر فوجی نوعیت کی تحقیق بھی ممکن بنائ اور پاکستانی سائنسدانوں کی لیزر کے شعبہ میں مہارت مزید بڑھی.1987 میں دنیا کی سب سے بڑی ایٹمی اور سائنسی لیبارٹری CERN کے سائنسدانوں کا گروہ پاکستان کے عمومی دورہ پہ آیا. انھیں چند پاکستانی جامعات میں لیکچر دے کہ واپس چلے جانا تھا. NILOP کے سائنسدانوں کو ان غیر ملکی مہمانوں کا پتہ چلا تو انھیں اپنی لیبارٹری آنے کی دعوت دی.  جب CERN کے سائنسدان NILOP میں داخل ہوئے تو حیران ہو گئے.  پاکستان جیسے ملک میں اتنی جدید وسیع اور بلند پائے کی لیزر تحقیقاتی ادارے کی موجودگی کا انھیں گمان بھی نہ تھا.  NILOP میں کام کرنے والے انجنیئر,سائنسدان اور ٹکنیشین سے ان کی بات ہوئ تو جیسے ایک کاریگر دوسرے کاریگر کے ہنر کو فوراً جانچ لیتا ہے, CERN کے مہمان پاکستانیوں کے علم اور مہارت سے متاثر ہو کر گئے. 
واپس جا کر انھوں نے دوسرے سائنسدانوں کو اپنے پاکستان کے دورے کے احوال سنائے. CERN نے بھانپ لیا کہ ملک پاکستان کے یہ لوگ بین الاقوامی سائنس کی ترقی میں اہم کردار ادا کر سکتے ہیں. 
1989 میں CERN نے ایک انتہائ پیچیدہ مشین  CMS Compact muon solenoid پہ کام شروع کیا جس میں لیزر کے کئ پرزہ جات لگنے تھے.اس منصوبہ کے لیئے   لیزر کے تمام پرزے بنانے کاکام پاکستان کے ادارے NILOP کو دیا گیا. اور ساتھ ہی NILORE کو CERN میں لیزر کے ذریعے نپائ کر کہ چند انتھائ بڑے سینسر ٹھیک جگہ پہ لگانے کی ذمہ داری بھی سونپی گئی. CMS کا منصوبہ 2007 میں مکمل ہوا اور پاکستانی سائنسدان بھی اس کی تکمیلی مراحل پہ کام کیلیئے CERN میں موجود تھے.  اور یوں ایٹمی اور لیزر سائنس میں پاکستان کی مہارت کا سب کو پتہ چلا.  2007 میں ہی لیزر کے ایک اور اولین موجد اور نوبل انعام یافتہ سائنسدان چارلز ٹاؤنز نے پاکستان اور NILORE کا دورہ کیا. 
دوسری طرف لیزر کے ذریعے ایٹمی ایندھن اور ایٹم بم کے بارود,  یورانیم اور پلوٹویم کی کشید اور افزودگی کے نئے طریقہ پہ تقریباً بیس سال کام جاری رہا . اور 2001 کے قریب پاکستان اس قابل ہوا کہ چند کنٹینروں میں لگے کمپیوٹرائزڈ لیزر آلات سے یورانیم اور پلوٹونیم افزودہ کیا جاتا ہے. اس کام کے لیئے ایک خاص قسم کی لیزر DYE LASER استعمال ہوتی ہے اور سافٹویر بھی پاکستان کا اپنا ہے. اس طریقہ کو Laser isotope separation کہتے ہیں. 
اب پاکستان کی ایٹمی صلاحیت اچانک حملہ کے خطرات سے محفوظ ہیں. 
کسی بھی خطرہ کی صورت میں یا رازداری قائم رکھنے کے لیئے آسانی کے ساتھ ایک جگہ سے دوسری جگہ منتقل کر کہ چھپائے جا سکتے ہیں. 
اور یوں لیزر اب پاکستان کے دفاع میں اہم کردار ادا کر رہی ہے

Marshall Aerospace and Defence has been contracted by special mission system provider Aerodata to convert two ATR 72-500s into maritime surveillance aircraft (MSA) for an undisclosed navy.

Marshall will design, manufacture and certify the special mission equipment on board the aircraft, which are expected to enter service with the customer in 2018 and 2019.

A radar, camera, self-protection equipment and stores pylons will be installed on the twin-engined turboprops at Marshall's Cambridge, UK site and a team of engineers will travel to Aerodata's location in Braunschweig, Germany throughout the installation.

Marshall adds there could be a later requirement to convert two more ATR 72s into the MSA configuration for the same customer.  (Reports have now emerged that the "undisclosed" customer is Pakistan navy)

A million Tons of Ice,Rock and mud Crashed on a #Pakistan Army camp in Gayari Siachin on the night of 7th April 2012. It was a freak of nature event where a large part of the Glacier broke off and came crashing down the slopes of the mountain at high speed. Fuel storage Tanks weighing 40 Tons were simply uprooted and carried a mile away with the force of the avalanche and then smashed on the mountains in the opposite side of the narrow valley .
It became one the rare and unique mountain rescue and recovery operation the world had ever seen. Techniques had to be invented to find the dead bodies of the fallen,as there was no precedence of a recovery operation of this magnitude under such conditions.
link_name: A one f a Kind rescue and recovery operation

A country called Afghanistan first appeared on the world map in 1709 when Hotaki Khan of Qandhaar conquered Iran,Parts of Pakistan and Tajikistan, Uzbekistan and all of Afghanistan. Hotak Khan was the first to call his dominion Afghanistan.(shown in blue) His dynasty lasted 40 years and was replaced by the Durrani empire . The Durranis had mixed Persian, Afghan origins and expanded their rule all the way to Delhi in present day India. They did not call their Dominion as Afghanistan as they were an alliance of various local rulers under the umbrella of the Durranis.  The Durranis ruled on areas of present day Pakistan was ended by Sikh Empire  who conquered Punjab, Kashmir, Peshawar and the whole of present day FATA,including parts of Baluchistan. That's why native Sikhs are still living in FATA and Baluchistan,and this era was the origin of "Pathan Vs Punjabi " banter which continues to this date. Sikh empire was ended by the British. 
Long story short,  if present day Afghans want to claim territory from other  countries based on historical rule of conquerors of  Afghan origin..They should ask territory from Iran,India,Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Iraq,  as parts of all these countries came under the rule of Conquerors of Afghan origin, instead of singling out Pakistan and crying Durand line. It's another thing that many of those so called Afghan Conquerors were actually of Mongol and central Asian origins who could trace their ancestry to Chengez Khan.

The Senate was informed on Thursday that the country has a marginal storage capacity of 14 million acre feet of water out of annually available 137 MAF.
During the question hour, replying to questions by members, Minister of State Jamal Kamal Khan said this constitutes just 10% of total water against the minimum threshold set by international experts as 30%.
He said if no new dams are constructed then there would be  an acute  shortage of water for irrigation in the country.
The Minister of State said the storage capacity of existing dams is decreasing gradually due to sedimentation.

F-16 production lines may be permanently shut down if USA fails to sell F-16 to Pakistan. 
Lockheed Martin has suffered from Indian lobbying against Pakistan and may sustain "Permanent damage ".
India failed to lure US senators from blocking sales of F-16 to Pakistan, but now has lobbied on blocking the release of assistance money from US treasury which had to pay for the deal.
Pakistan is aware of the situation but not concerned as Pakistan has other options readily available. 
If the deal fails, which is very likely, the only loser will be Lockheed Martin and the American skilled workforce who are set to lose their jobs if production lines shut down.
Indian government has told Lockheed that they are looking into transferring F-16 and F-18 production lines to India. But looking at India's track record on defense procurement (Hint:Rafale) this may remain an empty promise. 
Gone are the days when USA was a sovereign country.  Now half of their decisions are made by Israel, the other half by India. The country cannot sell their weapons, their biggest  export, without asking Israel and India.

Somewhere in KPK , Pakistan.
The problem is not resources,the problem is digging them out. The problem is not just government,its also the people. Just trying to explore oil and gas in any part of Pakistan creates a greed fueled storm so much so that exploration of oil and gas starts talk of breaking Pakistan. So it is counter productive to drill oil and gas in most areas of Pakistan.
If oil gas is drilled anywhere else in the world the land owner gets more than the normal price of his land or gets a monthly rent . The state or province gets around 20% of the total earnings as royalty.
In Pakistan the land owner,his neighbors,his village,the whole area and the provincial government asks all the bills to be deposited in their personal accounts.

The 240 Kilometre long Gwadar - Turbat - Hoshab motorway has finally been completed.  The Pakistan army's institution FWO built the motorway in 18 months. 
It may be noted that civilian contractors have abandoned work on the project three times due to workers being killed and kidnapped, machinery stolen and harassment by local tribal leaders. 
The project was initiated 14 years ago but couldn't be completed due to baloch insurgents. 
Eventually Pakistan Army took up the project, brought in the big guns, multiple intelligence based raids arrested  and killed baloch insurgents and ceased weapons and explosives in large quantities. 
Ever heard of another place in the world where you have to fight a war with them to give them progress?

نسلی اور قبائلی تعصبات کی تاریخ بہت قدیم ہے۔ خالق حقیقی نے نسل انسانی کی افزائش کا سلسلہ ہی کچھ اس طرح رکھا ہے کہ غیر اختیاری طور پر انسان جبلی اور فطری خونی رشتوں میں منسلک ہو تا ہے۔ لیکن اللہ تعالی نے سماجی حیوان کے طور پرمعاشرے میں زندگی گزارنے کے لئے روزاول سے کچھ ایسے اصول بھی عطا کر دیے جو اعزہ و اقارب کو باہم الفت و محبت کا پیکر بناتے ہیں۔ لیکن یہ اصول اس کے ساتھ ساتھ معاشرے میں ایسے فلاحی اور عادلانہ نظام کو بھی ترویج دیتے ہیں جہاں قبائلی اور نسلی تعصبات پروان نہ چڑھ سکیں۔ اور یہ بھی ایک مسلمہ تاریخی حقیقت ہے کہ ان تعصبات کے فروغ میں بنیادی کردار جہالت اور کم علمی کا ہوتا ہے۔ بعثت مصطفویۖ سے قبل کے دور کو کتب تاریخ و سیرت میں ایک جامع لفظ دور جاہلیت سے تعبیر کیا جاتا ہے۔ وہ پورا کا پورا معاشرہ دیگر اعتقادی اور عملی خرابیوں کے ساتھ ساتھ قبائلی اور نسلی تعصبات کی بھینٹ چڑھا ہوا تھا۔ قبیلوں کے سردارقابل احترام مگر انانیت اور نسلی برتری کے خول میں بند تھے۔ اکثر و بیشتر حق و باطل کی تمیز میں رکاٹ بھی ان کی یہی تعصبانہ ذہنیت ہوا کرتی تھی۔ دوسرے قبائل کے ساتھ خاک و خون کا کھیل ایک معمول بن چکا تھا۔ اسی بنا پر چھوٹی چھوٹی باتوں پر جنگ و جدال کا سلسلہ شروع ہو جاتا جو کئی کئی سالوں تک جاری رہتا اور اس میں کئی قیمتی جانیں ضائع ہو جاتیں ۔ شاید اِن اشعار میں ان ہی واقعات کی عکاسی ہے کہ

اصلاح معاشرہ کیلئے حضورنبی کریمۖ کے کیے گئے عملی اور دور رس اقدامات میں سے ایک قبائلی اور نسلی تعصبات کا قلع قمع کرنا ہے۔ اللہ تعالی نے سورہ الحجرات کی آیت نمبر تیرہ میں ارشاد فرمایا کہ اے بنی نوع انسان بیشک ہم نے تمہیں ایک مرد اور ایک عورت سے پیدا فرمایا ہے اور تمہاری باہم پہچان اور شناخت کیلئے گروہ اور قبیلے بنا دیے۔ اللہ تعالی کے ہاں تم میں سے وہی قابل احترام ہے جو پرہیزگار اور متقی ہے ۔ بیشک اللہ تعالی جاننے والا اور خبر رکھنے والا ہے ۔ اس آیت کریمہ میں اس بات کو واضح کردیا گیا کہ برادریوں اور قبیلوں میں تقسیم کی حکمت فقط شناخت اور پہچان ہے۔ حقیقی معنوں میں عنداللہ عزت و احترام کا معیار قبیلہ ہے نہ ذات۔ رنگ ہے نہ نسل بلکہ فقط خوف خدا اوراللہ کی ذات سے مضبوط تعلق ہے۔ ایک حدیث مبارکہ میں آپۖ نے فرمایا کہ اللہ تعالی تمہاری صورتوں اور رنگوں کو نہیں بلکہ تمارے دلوں کی کیفیات کو دیکھتا ہے۔ خطبہ حجة الوداع کے موقع پر جب اللہ پاک کی طرف سے تکمیل دین کا مژدہ جانفزا سنایا جارہا تھا تو اس موقع پر حضورۖ نے ارشاد فرمایا کہ کسی عربی کو عجمی یا عجمی کو عربی پر کوئی فوقیت نہیں۔ کسی گورے کو کالے اور کالے کو گورے پر کوئی برتری نہیں ۔یہی وجہ تھی کہ آپ ۖ کے تشکیل کردہ معاشرے میں ایران سے آنے والے حضرت سلمان فارسی، روم سے ہجرت کر کے آنے والے حضرت صعیب رومی اور سرزمین حبشہ سے تعلق رکھنے والے حضرت بلال حبشی ایک اعلی ترین مقام و مرتبہ پاگئے۔ جب حضرت عمر کے دور خلافت میں حضرت بلال کا وصال ہوا تو کم و بیش چھبیس لاکھ مربع میل کے خلیفہ وقت حضرت عمر فرماتے ہیں کہ قد مات سیدنا الیوم آج ہمارا سردار دنیا سے چل بسا۔ ہجرت کے بعد جب ریاست مدینہ کا قیام عمل میں آتا ہے تو وزارت خزانہ کا قلمدان بھی حضرت بلال کے سپرد کیا جاتا ہے جو رنگ کے سیاہ اور آزاد کردہ غلام ہیں۔ اسی طرح مسجد نبوی شریف کے موذن ہونے کی سعادت بھی ان ہی کے حصے میں آتی ہے فتح مکہ کے موقع پر جب حضرت بلال خانہ کعبہ کی چھت پہ چڑھ کے اذان دے رہے تھے تو مکہ کے سردار سٹپٹائے کہ یہ کیا ہو رہا ہے۔ طرح طرح کی بیہودہ باتیں کیں لیکن انہیں معلوم نہ تھا کہ تعلیمات مصطفیۖ نے رنگ و نسل کے امتیازات اور نسلی تعصبات سے انسانیت کو چھٹکارہ دے دیا ہے اور عزت و احترام اور بود و باش کے معیار تبدیل ہو چکے ہیں۔ حقیقت یہی ہے کہ رنگ و نسل اور قبیلہ و ذات تو غیر اختیاری اور فطری طور پر قدرت کی طرف سے عنائت کیے جاتے ہیں۔ جس میں بندے کی خواہش شامل ہوتی ہے نہ مرضی۔ انصاف کا تقاضا بھی یہی ہے کہ اظہار عظمت افراد کی حسن کارکردگی اور اختیاری معاملات میں ہونا چاہیے نہ کہ فقط برادری، رنگ اور نسل کی وجہ سے۔ لیکن بصد افسوس کہنا پڑتا ہے کہ آج ہماری تباہی اور بربادی کے جملہ اسباب میں سے ایک زمانہ جاہلیت کے وہی قبائلی جھگڑے، برادری ازم کی چپقلش اور رنگ و نسل کے امتیازات ہیں ۔ لیکن اسکے ساتھ ساتھ سینے پہ بیج اسلام کا لٹکایا ہواہے جو مصنوعی بھی ہو سکتا ہے اور حقیقی بھی۔

status_message:
Using Normal civilian satellite phone services,  Pakistani cruise missiles have the ability to send back a text message moments before hitting the target. 
Pakistan does not have spy satellites which can verify if a cruise missile attack has been successful or the missile strayed off target or worse still,  was found out and shot down by enemy air defense. 
To compensate for lack of a surveillance  satellite which can confirm if missile had hit the target or not, a very cost effective and readily available method had been integrated on all Pakistani cruise missiles. 
Basically a civilian satellite phone integrated into missile electronic compartment, which is programmed to send back an "I am OK" message. 
If the message Is not received, another cruise missile is launched using a different route. 

www.Pakistanaffairs.pk

20th August 1998 an American Tomahawk Cruise missile fell in Pakistani territory in spectacularly pristine condition.Most of the missile remained intact,the warhead did not explode and fuel did not catch fire.
It was an opportunity "Out of the blue" for Pakistan. Despite American demands ,Pakistan kept the missile and it was thoroughly studied. Software was extracted and studied and so was the hardware. At the time Pakistan had already started Cruise missile program and then this happened which propelled Pakistani Cruise missile program years ahead and cut the cost many times. Systems which #Pakistan had to make themselves after much research and expenditure ,simply fell into our laps for reverse engineering.
Pakistan openly said they will study the missile and incorporate any information gained into own cruise missile program.  But American experts said it's not possible to gain any knowledge from a fallen, partially destroyed missile. 

www.pakistanaffairs.pk
link_name: When a cruise missile fell in Pakistan

After creation of Pakistan the Government of Pakistan tried to establish writ of the state in Tribal areas and Pakistan army was deployed on Afghanistan Pakistan borders. Government control is essential for any development work and to establish an economy which generates tax revenues and employment. Tax revenues is what pays for the cost of any development work in any country.
Unfortunately the tribes stuck to their ancient traditions of not agreeing to any government control and Pakistan army came under constant attacks. Late 1947 decision was taken to withdraw Pakistan army from Tribal areas as it was proving to be a fruitless effort locking up valuable resources which could be used elsewhere.
Tribes were left on their own as that was what they wanted. But while they did not agree on living under the control of a central government like the rest of Pakistan,they couldn't help themselves either and no development work happened in the area. Today in 2015,not much has changed.

A 1970 video shows Tribesmen of Khyber agency making Hashish and then smuggling out of the Agency  on Donkeys. The normal looking donkey caravans with children walking with them actually carried Narcotics.
The story of most parts of FATA hasn't changed for thousands of years. They want to remain free but wont stop creating problems for everyone around them,in this case growing,manufacturing and smuggling of narcotics. Eventually when those effected,be it Pakistan or a foreign power,takes action,the tribes claim that their lands have been invaded and their freedom compromised and a bloody fight goes on for many years. The "Foreign invaders" leave and the tribes get back to their normal business,creating trouble for everyone around them by smuggling drugs,ammunitions and explosives to them.
Now the "Business" has gone a step ahead with for sale suicide bombers available in many parts of FATA.
Multiple reports have surfaced where investigation has found out that if you are in contact with the right person,normally a TTP commander,and pay him a few lakh rupees,they will arrange a suicide bomber for you to go destroy a target of your choice.
Not to mention that North Waziristan's capital city the Miranshah Bazar was found full of "For sale" Suicide wests,IEDs and military grade explosives which locals made themselves as business venture.
Nobody can fix them,because they don't think they are broken,only they themselves can fix this pathetic situation they have been for thousands of years with no end in sight,all because of the mentality they pass on from one generation to the next.

Before the creation of #Pakistan the Pushtoon population of then NWFP now  #KPK were asked if they want to join Pakistan or India. The Pushtoon wing of Indian congress party , Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan's #ANP first tried to create hurdles against the referrendum making all sorts of allegations , also they tried to persuade  the Pushtoons to demand a separate "Pushtoonistan". failing all that they simply boycotted the referendum.
The Referendum started on 20 July 1947 and was completed in ten days. The turn out was 50.11 percent as out of the total 572799 electorate 292118 cast their votes. Of these, 289244 votes were cast in favor of Pakistan and 2874 went to red boxes. Thus of the polled votes Pakistan got 99.02 percent while India got only 0.98 percent.

INS Khukri was a Type 14 (Blackwood-class) frigate of the Indian Navy. She was sunk off the coast of Diu, Gujarat, India by the Pakistan Navy Daphné-class submarine Hangor on 9 December 1971 during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971. This was the first warship sunk in action by a submarine since World War II.

This robot was made by Pakistani students. Now its being sold as a scientific experimental project for developers. (Contact written at the end of the video) The idea is simple and brilliant. Instead of developing purpose made hardware,the inventor has used  a powerful smart phone and written a program that runs on Android . The smart phone runs the software and via that controls the body of the robot. Balance is kept by already fitted Gyroscopes and accelerometers now common in high end smartphones. By using already available resources instead of building new,the inventor has kept the cost low and also the software is open source on well understood Android platform, and can be modified for various uses and requirements. Inventor : Osama Farooq Rama
www.pakistanaffairs.pk

Second part of the video shows Nehru sighing contract with Canada in 1956 for installation of Nuclear reactor in India and training staff. 
On the other hand #Pakistan signed a similar contract 10 years later in 1966. Even then our Civilian Nuclear program has been running smoothly . www.pakistanaffairs.pk

AIR WAR OF 1965 REVISITED - #Pakistan Air Force #PAF C-130 Bombing Operations
C-130 Heavy Bomber

On the night of 11/12 September, the first bombing mission was undertaken by Wing Commander Zahid Butt against the target of Kathua Bridge 16 Kms East of Pathankot. This bridge formed a vital link for the supply line to Indian ground troops. Gauging the dangerous nature of the mission, Chaklala's Station Commander Group Captain Eric Hall also went along on the mission. Flight Lieutenant Rizwan was the navigator. They reached the target safely and during the bombing run, they were attacked by an enemy fighter. Wing Commander Zahid Butt took evasive action only after the bombs had been released. On successful return to the base, they discovered a 1 cm bullet hole in the port wing tip.

After the Kathua bombing raid, the next target for the C-130 bombers was a concentration of enemy tanks and guns, three miles north of Ramgarh in the Sialkot Sector. Two C-130s dropped nine tons of bombs each on the night of 15 September and played a major role in shattering the enemy forces moving up for the battle of Chawinda. On the following night, a single C-130 strike was repeated against Ramgarh destroying enemy tanks and guns as well as ammunition and fuel dumps. 

On the night of 19th September, two successful C-130s sorties were made against Indian Army concentrations in the vicinity of Rurki and Pagowal, and apart from the resulting material damage, the effect on enemy morale was believed to be devastated. 

In the closing stages of the 1965 War, the Indians had amassed their heavy guns close to the BRB canal to concentrate their heavy artillery fire on Lahore. On 21st September a single C-130 dropped ten tons of bombs on the heavy artillery four miles south-east of Jallo. Another C-130 dropped nine tons of bombs on Indian artillery concentration at Valtoha. On 22nd September bad weather hampered PAF strike action against the assembled Indian artillery but the inclement weather did not deter three C-130s taking off that night to find the enemy target and drop their bombs by radar. The target at Atari included an Indian AA Regiment with 72 guns, located in a strip about one mile long running parallel with and close to the BRB canal. The Army was reluctant in giving clearance to the C-130s for fear of breaching the BRB or worse still, the bombs landing on our own troops this side of the canal. Permission was finally granted and the C-130s conducted a highly accurate drop of more than 30 tons of TNT which devastated the Indian artillery. Many independent observers believe this last action by PAF set the Indians clamouring for a ceasefire. Seven officers of the Transport Wing were awarded the Sitara-e-Jurat and 2 JCOSs the Tamgha-e-Jurat.

Research & Text written by : 
Sarmad Hassan Sharif
link_name: PAF C-130 Bombed Indian Army during 1965 war

Later investigation revealed that the political party claiming to be the only representative of Mohajirs and "Fighting for the rights" of Mohajirs was involved in the incident. Here is a video of an ex-MQM leader Afaq Ahmad about the incident and later events.
#MQM used their political powers to block the bail of Factory owners and also blocked his attempts to sell the plot of the factory. Mainly as a face saving attempt as release of the owner had opened a Pandora box against MQM.
As a result the families of the deceased and injured did not get any compensation to this date. The factory owner was trying to sell the plot so that money could be arranged to pay compensation to poor families of the dead and those injured to an extent that they are disabled for life.

Nankana Lake Resort is located two miles from Nankana Sahib City, in the heart of Punjab. The resort is located on the border of two old land grants of the mid-15th century; Rai Bular's Estate and the old Rajput trail through authentic Punjabi villages approx. 90 Kilometers from Lahore (Midway between Lahore & Faisalabad). Nankana Lake Resort follows an early precedent set by Rai Bular, the pioneer who founded the original City of Talwandi (now Nankana Sahib) that has attracted visitors to the area from all over the world since 1457 A.D. The resort provides guests with the very best of facilities in which to relax and get away from the urban noise.
www.pakistanaffairs.pk

Primary beneficiaries of the project will be 568000 farming families in the Lower Chenab Canal (LCC) command area who will be ensured of reliable irrigation supplies. There continues to be a concerted effort by some western and Indian governments and the mainstream media to demonize the ISI, the Inter-Services Intelligence agency of Pakistan. Some Pakistanis, particularly Pakistani liberals, are also part of this anti-ISI campaign.
To put unrelenting attacks on the ISI in perspective, let's read some excerpts from an interview of ex CIA officer and chief Bin Laden hunter Michael Scheuer on ISI, and watch the following video:

1. ISI is like all other intelligence services--like the Australian service or the American service.

2. ISI works for the interest of their country, not to help other countries.

3. The idea that ISI is a rogue organization is very popular--and even the Pakistanis promote it---but having worked with ISI for the better part of 20 years, I know the ISI is very disciplined and very able intelligence agency.

4. Pakistanis can not leave the area (AfPak) when we (Americans) do. They have to try and stabilize Afghanistan with a favorable Islamic government so they can move their 100,000 troops from their western border to the eastern border with India which---whether we like it or not, they see as a bigger threat.

5. We (US) have created the mess in South Asia and the Pakistanis have to sort it out. Our (US) problems in Afghanistan are of our own making.

6. Al Qaeda has grown from just one platform (Afghanistan in 2001) to six platforms now.

شاہین سوئم میزائل کا تجربہ کچھ ہی روز پہلے ہوا ـ یہ ایک انتہائ جدید میزائل ہے جس میں کافی طاقتور راکٹ موٹر استعمال کی گئی ہے ـ
وڈیو میں دیکھا جا سکتا ہے کہ میزائل فائر ہونے کے چند لمحے بعد بجائے سیدھا اوپر جانے کے بائیں جانب جھکنا شروع ہو جاتا ہے اور تقریباﹰ چالیس سیکنڈ بعد سطح عرض کے متوازی اڑ رہا ہوتا ہے ـ
یہ میزائل چھ سو نوے کلومیٹر اوپر خلاء میں جا کر واپس اپنے حدف کی طرف پلٹ سکتا ہے ـ
مگر اس ٹیسٹ میں ایسا ہوتا نظر نہیں آ رہا ـ
اس کا مطلب یہ ہے کہ میزائل کو قصداً نیچا رکھا جا رہا ہے تاکہ دشمن کے ریڈار میں کافی نزدیک جا کر نظر آئے ـ اور اسطرح کی نیچی پرواز سے میزائل کا حدف تک پہنچنے کا وقت بھی بہت کم ہو جاتا ہے ـ یوں دشمن کو میزائل کے خلاف دفاعی اقدامات کا موقع نہیں ملتا ـ
بھارت نے میزائل کو دیکھنے والے ریڈار لگائے ہوئے ہیں اور آنے والے میزائل کو مار گرانے کا نظام نھی لگایا ہوا ہے ـ
مگر پاکستان ایسا میزائل بنا چکا ہے جو نیچی پرواز کرے تاکہ ان کے ریڈار پہ دیر سے نظر آئے ـ اور اتنی جلدی اپنے حدف تک جا پہنچے کہ بھارت کے دفاعی نظام کو متحرک ہونے کا موقع ہی نہ ملے 

It has been a few days since Pakistan test fired Latest Shaheen 3 Ballistic Missile.
The missile leans at an angle soon after launch and is almost parallel to earth's surface at around 45 seconds after launch.
This indicates something called "Depressed Trajectory" or a missile path where the missile simply does not rise too high and maintains a flat path towards target.
Such a trajectory is designed to shorten missile flight time significantly , giving enemy less time to react.

Rangers spokesperson briefs media on MQM raid :
Rangers official Colonel Tahir, while speaking to the media, said the raid inside and around Nine-Zero was conducted on a tip-off regarding presence of criminals in the area.
Tahir said weapons, earlier stolen from Nato containers, were seized during the raid. "Certain ammunition recovered is banned in Pakistan," he added.
He said target killers and other offenders were arrested during the operation.
The colonel also said no MNA or MPA was arrested during the search, however, he said MQM leader Amir Khan was held for questioning and will be allowed to leave once the interrogation is over. "Amir will be questioned why were criminals present inside Nine-Zero," he explained

غداروں کا انجام
Sheikh Mujib of East Pakistan had dreams of Ruling   a country after breaking it away from Pakistan. He had all the help he wanted from India.
But after the job was done,what happened to him?
غداروں کا انجام ـ شیخ مجیب کو بھارت نے خوب نوازا ـ جوش دلایا ـ مالی ـ فوجی . سیاسی اور ہر طرح کی مدد کی ـ
شیخ مجیب سمجھا کہ اب تو وہ پاکستان ٹوٹتے ہی بادشاہت کرے گا ـ
مگر بیرونی طاقتیں جب غداروں کو استعمال کرتی ہیں تو کام پورا ہوتے ہی ان کو ختم کر دیتی ہیں ـ
مجیب کے ساتھ بھی ایسا ہی ہوا  - بنگلادیش بننے کے کچھ ہی عرصے بعد قتل ہو گیا ـ
بلوچ سردار بھی آج اسی راستہ پہ چل رہے ہیں ـ وہ بھارت کی گود میں بیٹھے ہوئے ہیں اور سمجھ رہے ہیں کہ پاکستان کو توڑ کر وہ تیل گیس بیچیں گے اور بادشاہت والی زندگی بسر کریں گے ـ ایسا کبھی نہیں ہوگا ـ انھیں بھی ان کے مددگار ٹھکانے لگا کہ تیل گیس بھارت ماتا کے نام کر لیں گے اور بلوچوں کو مصروف رکھنے کے لیئے بگٹی ـ مرّی  اور دوسرے قبائل کی آپس میں جنگ کرا دیں گے جو جاری رہے گی ـ پھر وہی بیرونی طاقتیں کبھی ایک قبیلے کی دوسرے کے خلاف مدد کر کہ ان کے علاقہ سے معدنیات نکالیں گی ـ اور پھر جب وہاں معدنیات ختم ہونگی تو دوسرے قبیلہ کی حامی بن کر ان کے زیر اثر علاقہ سے معدنیات نکالیں گی ـ اور بلوچ بلوچ کا نسلوں تک گلا کاٹتا رہے گا ـ
آج بالکل اهدا ہی عراق ـ شام ـ یمن اور پورے افریقہ میں ہو رہا ہے ـ
پاکستان کی قدر کرو ـ یہ ہے تو تم ہو ـ اس ملک کے بغیر تم کچھ نہیں

The story of Gomal Zam dam Waziristan.

Its not easy to do any development in FATA.
2002 Dam construction started. 
2004 Two chinese engineers were killed by Local Taliban.
2007 work was given to Army for security reasons
2012 construction of main dam was completed,canals were still being built.
2012 , 7 workers were kidnapped,one killed and the rest were kept in captivity for a whole year then released.
2015 Irrigation canals were fully operational.


12 Billion Rs, 13 years of hard work and loss of many lives for such a small project?

At the end of the video you can see what the locals have to say about Taliban. They are quite happy with Taliban.

Thats why FATA is so backward

Rare Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in Pakistan 
http://www.pakistanaffairs.pk/
The footprints of two important dinosaurs have been discovered in Pakistan. The theropods and wide gauge titanosaurian sauropods belonged to the Middle Jurassic period.

After Ardley site in UK, it is the second in the world and first in Asia where footprints and trackways of wide gauge Middle Jurassic titanosaurian sauropods and a theropod hunter have been found. The site in Pakistan is located in Malakhel, Mianwali. It is also the only site in the world where the deepest footprints of dinosaurs have been discovered.

But one part of this spectacular site has been destroyed by local mine owners and there is an urgent need to protect the rest of the footprints.
link_name: Rare Dinosaur Footprints Discovered in Pakistan

If this generation doesn't then I am sure a generation before ours definitely remembers this famous landmark of Pakistan which was called kala chapra (the black hangar).

This hangar was part of a 3-structure complex to house R101 and R102 type airships. The other two structures included a tall mooring mast to dock the airship and in the base of the mast was a hydrogen plant to refuel the airship.

The base of the mast contained buildings followed along the baseline in an octagonal shape. The hydrogen plant had enough gasometers to completely fill the R101 airship with 5.5 million cubic ft of gas.

The construction on this hangar complex started in 1927 and complete in 1929. The size of this hangar was 859ft L x 200ft W x 170ft H. In 1920s Karachi airport area was nothing but a desolate desert. In contrast to that landscape this hangar appeared as such a visual magnanimity that for many years it was used as a visual marker for airplanes attempting VFR (visual) landing in Karachi. Due to the enormosity of this structure to its surroundings, local residents of Karachi started calling this hangar as kala chapra (black hangar) – The word 'chapra' (or 'chappar') has almost become archaic in Urdu used in Pakistan these days. It means a 'shed'. Many current residents of the city who have seen this structure still recall it by its local name 'kala chapra.'The cost of building this hangar complex in 1928 came out to be 93000 British pounds.

So why was this hangar and the adjoining mooring mast complex built in Karachi? It was part of a airship communication scheme of British Government in 1924 to connect far fetched areas of British Empire with a airship service. Big airplanes were not available then and those which were available were noisy, uncomfortable and not suited for long distance travel. The mode of transport which seemed to have best chance then were the airships. These offered quiet and comfortable journey for passengers and could lift heavy cargo too. The Imperial Airship Communications Scheme was thus developed to provide mail and passenger service from Canada at one end of British Empire to Cardington, Englad to Egypt in Africa to Karachi in then India. Another leg was proposed to connect India with Australia later on.

The home base of R101 airships was in Cardington, Bredfordshire England. The mooring mast at Karachi was exactly the same size and style as the one at Cardington (shown below) except for the octagonal building at the base of Karachi mast.

A 777ft long airship called R101 was developed for this service in 1927. The width of R101 airship was 131ft and height was 140ft. Airship mooring masts were erected at St Hubert in Canada, at Ismailia in Egypt and at Karachi which was selected as the terminus in then British India.

The length of the hangar in Karachi was kept 859ft so that it could fit the future R102 model of airships which was going to have a length of 822ft. The hangar however never got chance to host either R101 or R102 airships.

On October 4, 1930 the R101 flew from Cardington, England on its way to Karachi but on its maiden flight it crashed in France. This crash essentially put an end to R101 type airships and Imperial Airship Communication scheme of the British Government. Eventhough the airship program got cancelled, the hangar and mast complex survived for 30 more years.

In 1952, the Government of Pakistan decided to bring down the complex and sell the metal structure for scrap. The structure managed to survive till 1960 when it was finally brought down and steel was sold or used on Railway structures and bridges across Pakistan. This brought an end to the lifecycle of this unique piece of civil engineering in Pakistan.

Location of Black Hangar versus Isphahani Hangar?

One thing I am not sure myself yet is whether the present day wide-body Isphahani Hangar of PIA is located at exactly the same place where once this Black Hangar stood or is it in a different location. I know for sure the general vicinity of both hangars is Karachi Airport but don't know if they shared the exact same spot. Our readers comments and citations are sought here. I'll make the update once we confirm it either way.

Karachi Airport has a railway station on Pakistan's Main Railway track. The station today is simply called 'Airport'. But for few years in the 1920s before Karachi airport was built, this railway station was called 'Airship'.

From a Blog written by Owais Mughal.

THE ONLY DAUGHTER OF QUAID E AZAM MUHAMMAD ALI JINAH
www.pakistanaffairs.pk
A very sad "Dina Wadia" after a 2004 visit to her Dad's Mausoleum in Karachi. She Visited her dad's Grave only twice. First time in 1948 and then in 2004.
That was her so far last visit to Quaid's Tomb. Press was not allowed and the visit was kept low key on her request.She was whizzed in and out of the Tomb under heavy guard of Pakistan Navy Commandos.

Her mother Maryam Jinnah was herself the Daughter of a Textile tycoon of Bombay. Dina was born in 1919 but our Quaid's Marriage with her Mother Shirin Jinnah suffered heavily due to his Devotion towards the cause of Creating Pakistan.
He could not give time to his family and his wife Shirin Jinnah Left him in 1922 along with his and her only child Dina wadhia.

Quaid's only Daughter had off and on contact with her dad. 
As a teen age rebel she chose to marry someone her dad did not approve of and since then lost all contact with Quaid e Azam . She chose her seperate path and our Quaid remained devoted to the struggle of creating Pakistan.
She later inherited her Maternal Grand dad's Business empire , known today as "Bombay Dying Group" and is a multi billion Dollar business.

The Business empire is now part of India's Famous Tata group. Dina wadia still lives in Bombay at the age of 90+

PAKISTAN'S UNIVERSITY CONTACTED BY BAHRAIN FOR TEACHING THEIR STUDENTS SATELLITE TECHNOLOGY
www.Pakistanaffairs.pk #Urdu
Institute of space technology Islamabad made and launched (Onboard a Russian rocket) the iCube-1 micro satellite with a small budget of 3.5 million Rupees.
The satellite weighs 1.5Kg and is fitted with radio transmitters and a VGA camera.
The experimental satellite orbits at an altitude of 600Km and sends health data and low resolution pictures of earth to Institute of space technology's control station.
Students and Teachers at #NUST joined hands to build this satellite and control station in a period of four years.
The experience gained is now being recognized internationally and Bahrain recently contacted #IST  for teaching space technology to their students.

PIA TO THE RESCUE

Passengers of PIA special relief flight PK-7622 from Turkey received & garlanded by senior officials of PIA including Assistant Manager Public Relations Athar Hasan Awan at Allama Iqbal International Air Port (AIIAP), Lahore, on March 2, 2011. PIA arranged a relief flight to Dalaman, Turkey, to bring back stranded Pakistanis who had arrived in Marmaris, Turkey, due to the unrest in Libya. PIA operated its Airbus A310-300 aircraft to transport 195 passengers including 2 infants. Capt. Syed Mohammad Ali Gilani and Capt. Waseem Pirzada operated the relief flight

شہد کوارٹر ماسٹر صوبیدار فضل ربی باجوڑ لیویز میں  بحیثیت سپاہی 1980  میں  بھرتی ہوئے۔شاندار

      کارگردگی کی بنیاد پر جلد جلدترقی پاتے گئے۔2005  میں  رٹایئرمنٹ کے بعدانتظامیہ نے ان کے فرض شناسی ،بہادری،بولڈ کردا ر   ,اورمحکمہ کو ضرورت کے پیش نظر کنٹریکٹ کی بنیاد پردوبارہ بھرتی کیا۔
اگست 2008ئ میں  لوئے سم کے مقام پر ایک پوسٹ کو دوبارہ بحال کرنے کے لئے آپ وہاں  گئے جو اس وقت دہشت گردوں کا گڑہ تھا۔دہشت گردوں  نے ان کو ساتھیوں  سمیت چاروں  طرف سے گھیر لیا۔مگرشہید اور شہےد کے ساتھیوں  نے ڈٹ کر مقابلہ 
      کیا۔اور مسلسل 4دن اور5راتیں بغیر کچھ کھائے پیئے اور امدا لیئے دہشت گردوں  کا مردانہ وار مقابلہ کیا جو ان کی شجاعت کی ایک  مثال ہے۔ان کی فرض شناسی اور بہادری کو دیکھتے ہوئے 23 مارچ 2010 ئ کو صدر پاکستان نے تمغہ شجاعت سے نوازا گیا۔ شہید بم ڈسپوزل اسکواڈ کے انچارج بہی تہے 

شہید کے جرائ ت مندانہ کردار کی وجہ سے دہشت گردوں  کے لئے یہ علاقہ (باجوڑ)جہنم تھا۔جس کی وجہ سے ان پر کئی باربم،راکٹ

      اور فائرنگ کے زریعے قاتلانہ حملے کئے گئے اور بار بار وارننگ دی گئی۔مگر شہےد سیسہ پلائی ہوئے دیوار کی طرح ان کے سامنے ڈٹے 
رہے۔اور بلآخرڈیوٹی کے دوران ایجنسی ہےڈ کوارٹر خاربازار میں  4مئی 2012 ئ کو ایک بزدلانہ خودکش حملے میں  شہید کر دئے گئے.

REMEMBER THE LARGE ISLAND FORMED OVERNIGHT ON THE COAST OF BALUCHISTAN?
www.pakistanaffairs.pk
Video showing formation of an Island as a result of Mud volcano eruption.

On sep 24 2013 a magnitude 7.7 earthquake hit Baluchistan,killing many people. Strange new island appeared of the coast of Gawadar as a result of the earthquake. The island was formed due to a large mud volcano eruption. Mud volcanoes are a blessing,as they are formed as a result of rock grinding due to the tectonic plates sliding past each other. The pulverized rock,mixed with sea water,then goes on to lubricate the sliding tectonic plates,reducing the severity  of earthquakes.
When plates slide past each other,mud is discharged through vents in earth's crust,and they are called mud volcanoes.
Only certain types of rocks are soft enough to be ground,mixed with sea water and then act as lubricants for tectonic activity. If the rock is hard,the plates get stuck,and eventually when they do slide,they slide with immense force and cause much large and violent earthquakes and tsunamis.

EMPEROR BABUR'S THRONE NEAR CHAKWAL,PUNJAB,PAKISTAN

It is said that the great Mughual Emperor Babar in India while passing by this place stayed here and liked the beauty of this place in 1519 AD. He also ordered a construction of a garden here that still exist here which is named as Bagh e Safa or The Mughual Garden.

Here is a stone made throne. Its is made by engraving a structure of a throne on the big rock which included a few stairs and a flat platform on which Emperor Babar used to stand and give instruction to his army men.
It is also said that Emperor Babar used to spend a lot of time at this spot doing meditation.

WAZIR KHAN MOSQUE #LAHORE #PAKISTAN,مسجد وزیر خان 

It was built in seven years, starting around 1634–1635 AD, during the reign of the Mughal Emperor Shah Jehan. It was built by Hakim Shaikh Ilm-ud-din Ansari, a native of #Chiniot, who rose to be the court physician to Shah Jahan and a governor of Lahore. He was commonly known as #Wazir Khan, a popular title bestowed upon him (the word Wazir means 'minister' in Urdu and Persian). The mosque is inside the Inner City and is easiest accessed from #Delhi Gate. The mosque contains some of the finest examples of Qashani tile work from the Mughal period.

ANYONE FOR A PET CHEETAH?

Pakistan and India had their own species of Cheetah, called the Asiatic cheetah. This species was domesticated and trained for hunting since times of Mogul kings. Mughal Kings regularly brought their pet Cheetahs during their Hunting expeditions. This tradition was passed on to Rajas and Nawabs of the region. The last Known Domesticated Asiatic Cheetahs are Photographed here.It was in 1942.

POST OFFICE OF PAKISTAN
www.pakistanaffairs.pk

Did you know Pakistan has 13000 Post offices,each with its own post code?

Pakistan Post Office is one of the oldest government departments in the Sub-Continent. In 1947, it began functioning as the Department of Post & Telegraph. In 1962 it was separated from the Telegraph & Telephone and started working as an independent attached department.
Pakistan Post is providing postal services in every nook and corner of the country through a network of around 13,000 post offices. Pakistan Post is providing delivery services to about 20 million households and businesses as community service without any cost considerations. In addition to its traditional role, the Pakistan Post also performs agency functions on behalf of Federal and Provincial governments, which inter-alias include Savings Bank, Postal Life Insurance, Collection of Taxes, Collection of Electricity, Water, Sui Gas and Telephone bills.

Pakistan Post is also providing a universal postal service network in harmony with the Universal Postal Union (UPU) strategy to ensure secure and timely delivery of mail, money and material at affordable cost through utilization of people, process and technology and innovative product offerings.

ZAMZAMA GUN OF #LAHORE
ہمارا پیج لائک کرنا مت بھولیں
It was cast in 1762 in Lahore, now in Pakistan but at the time part of the Durrani Empire. It is currently on display in front of the Lahore Museum in Lahore, #Pakistan.
 It was then used in battle after battle for 65 years (including the third battle of #Panipat against the Marathas, and by Sikhs in the battles of Daska, Kasur, Sujanpur, #Wazirabad, and the famous siege of #Multan in which this gun is credited with breaching the walls of Multan's fort), and it was seized by and back from Pashtuns and Sikhs a number of times. In fact it once became a bone of contention between 2 #Pashtun brothers, and 3 of their sons were killed fighting over it.

#Pakistan is one of the few countries in the world where buffalo milk is preferred over cow milk.We are the second largest producer and consumer of Buffalo milk in the world.

Special Pakistani breeds like Nili-Ravi and Kundi can produce 15-20 liters of milk a day.

لال شھباز قلندر

Born in Marand,Iran.Last resting Place at Sehwan Sindh.1177 – 1274
He was a great Sufi scholar of his times .He created harmony among different religions casts and sects of sindh during his time.He became a role model for the people of his time,and many converted to Islam under his teachings and influence. Being a man of Caucasian / Central Asian ethnic origin,
He was a tall muscular white man,and to induce humility in his  posture he wore a heavy stone as necklace.That stone still hangs besides his grave as a relic of the great sufi saint.

PAKISTANI BROTHER AND SISTER TEAM CONQUERS ANTARCTICA'S HIGHEST MOUNTAIN

**Please don't forget to like our page**

Pakistani mountaineers Samina Baig and Mirza Ali on Saturday successfully scaled Mount Vinson in #Antarctica, according to the Alpine Federation of #Pakistan.
The sister-brother mountaineer duo, which hails from #Shimshal in #Gilgit-#Baltistan (G-B), has been on an eight-month expedition to climb seven summits on seven continents since the end of November 2013.
They successfully climbed the 6,962-metre Mount Aconcagua in #Argentina in December 2013.

BEAST AND HUMAN IN PERFECT HARMONY
Picture was taken a Nagar valley Hunza.
Pakistan's endangered snow leopard cub curious about a #Chinese tourist.

Due to raised awareness in Northern areas of #Pakistan,specially #Hunza,many orphaned snow leopard cubs are hand reared by locals.
People like syed Yahya shah have rescued many adult and juvenile snow leopards and released them back in the wild.
Local villagers often trap snow leopards in fear of losing their cattle.

THE GREATEST KING IN BALOCH HISTORY

Mir Chakar Rind or Chakar e Azam  was a tribal cheif in 15th century who united baloch tribes and created a Baloch Kingdom.

Picture shows his tomb in #Okara #Punjab. Many of his tribe,the "Rind Baloch" are distributed all over Punjab from centuries.

Yet #Baloch separatist groups have the audacity to call "Punjabis" the enemies of #Baluch people. Our histories are intertwined and our future is bright as one united Pakistan and one Pakistani nation.

PAKISTAN NAVY'S EYES IN THE SKY
www.pakistanaffairs.pk
Picture shows Navy's Uqab Drone. Only 10 of these drones can keep a watchful eye on the whole of Pakistan's coast day and night. Operated by Navy marine batallion 

UQAB-II is an indigenously produced ground-launched tactical UAV in service with Pakistan's Navy since July 2011. The UAV is manufactured by GIDS  Pakistan and has a range of 100 km and endurance of more than 6 hours. The aircraft can carry a 20kg payload consisting of a gyro-stabilized gimbal with color day camera, and a thermal imager with target tracking and locking capabilities which can transmit real time video to the aircraft's ground control station (GCS).  The UQAB's GCS is a truck mounted air-conditioned, insulated container equipped with ruggedized consoles.

SHILAJIT OR SALAJIIT
سلاجیت
Picture shows shilajit being dried before sale in  Baltistan.

If you ever been to Northern Pakistan,you may have noticed people selling black or brown lumps of thick resin like mateial.
The vendors will tell you various medicinal advantages of the black matter.

Very little scientific research has ever been done on shilajit.

Similar material of different name is also found in mountains of central Asia and Antarctica.

Salajiit is found oozing out of rocks in Karakoram and Himalayas.

The material has been used in traditional medicines over the centuries.

A closer look at salajiit reveals that it is plant material which somehow got trapped in rock cravasses,remained there long enough to change shape and consistency,and later oozed out when rocks opened up.

The phenomenon can be related to mountain glaciers. Glaciers gather plant material,and often compress this deep inside rocks due to their inherent immense pressure.

When glaciers recede or change direction,the compressed earth slowly bounce back,opening cravasses wide enough to ooze out deposited plant material.

Since glaciers can remain in the same area for hundred of thousands of years,the plant material remains trapped and compressed for same period of time.

Salajiit is different from peate bog or petroleum,although all three are plant material trapped beneath the earth.
Peate bog forms when plants get buried in marshes.For petroleum the same material has to remain burried for millions of years,far below,in the depths of earth.

No two samples of Salajiit are the same.
Some have been found rich in minerals,other samples had glycerols.
For that reason the same medical benefits,if at all,cannot be attributed to Shilajit all over.

Due to the mysterious origin and rarity,ancient herbalists took fancy to the material.
A black paste oozing out of bare rock high in the mountains had mystified people for centuries.
It can be argued that apart from a general dietary supplement,whatever medicinal values have been attributed to Salajiit are a result of "Placebo effect".

MUNIR AHMED KHAN.THE UNKNOWN HERO OF PAKISTAN'S NUCLEAR BOMB

WWW.PAKISTANAFFAIRS.PK

Chairman of the Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission (PAEC) from 1972 to 1991.

Born	20 May 1926
Died	22 April 1999 (aged 72)

Under his Leadership Pakistan conducted 24 "Cold tests" of a nuclear device.The first cold test of a working nuclear device was conducted on 11 March 1983 at Kirana Hills which was followed by another two dozen cold tests till the early 1990s.

The bomb design was perfected and bombs were built long before the "Yaum-E-Takbeer" ,when Pakistan publicly detonated a nuclear bomb,under the leadership of Dr.A Q Khan.

PLUTONIUM REACTOR AT NILORE ISLAMABAD.

PARR.Originally procured in 1965 from USA for research purposes. Great scientists like Nobel prize winner Dr.Abdus salam worked here. Pakistani scientists replicated and improved the design and built two more on their own resources.

In 1991 a classified upgrade was performed on the reactors at NILORE. The reactors produce critical data on nuclear isotope products including weapons grade plutonium.
The reactors at NILORE are now a Pakistani design,built and operated by Pakistani scientists,used for research on classified isotopes. See more www.pakistanaffairs.pk

MONKEY BUSINESS, A LEAF FROM OUR ANCIENT HISTORY

When Alexander the great invaded the subcontinent,his army was mostly European. His soldiers had never seen monkeys.
When they entered hilly areas of current Pakistan,they saw small men on the trees shadowing them.
The soldiers were petrified by the skills of "Hairy little people" jumping from tree top to tree top.
Their commanders ordered the archers to kill the invading " tree army".
Many arrows flew,many poor monkey fell dead,and the few survivors were formally captured as "Prisoners of war" and presented before commanders for interrogation.
Many hours or days later,the interrogators couldn't understand a word of what the monkeys said in reply to their questions.
Eventually the Alexandrian army realized that these little hairy men are no army with supernatural powers of tree hopping,but these are poor little animals.
With this revelation,the monkeys were set free and the monkey business ended.

Sino-Pak Military Ties and Future

As early as over 2000 years ago, the world renowned Silk Road linked the two sides together in a connection. During the 7th century A.D., an eminent Chinese monk in the Tang Dynasty, who travelled westward has mentioned about his fond memory of the land and people in his famous book Records of Western Travels.

Modern age China-Pakistan relations began on 4 January 1950 when Pakistan was among the first countries to recognise the Peoples' Republic of China (PRC). Some interesting facts about cooking
Cooking is good for the brain. It's now thought that our ancestor, Homo erectus, first used fire to soften meat 1.8million years ago. Because the nutrients in cooked food are more easily absorbed.
Cooking also encouraged us to socialise, which expanded our neural pathways and made our brains grow larger. Mouths, once used mostly for ripping and grinding flesh, were able to spend more time talking and singing.

WHO REMEMBERS SKYLAB?
www.pakistanaffairs.pk

In June/July 1979 Radio Pakistan and PTV transmitted news of a large American satellite is about to crash and that the satellite has nuclear material on board.
It was also told to us that chances are the satellite might fall somewhere in Pakistan,India or Bangladesh.
The news created a Pre-Doomsday mood among the masses.
Many people left their everyday routine and spent their time in Mosques praying or doing things they wanted to do before they die.
The talk on the streets was that the world is coming to an end.
The large satellite with Plutonium batteries finally crashed near Australia on 11 July 1979.
How many of us still remember those tense days?

ANOTHER BLOW TO PROTESTS AGAINST DRONES.


PTI activists arrested for manhandling Nato truck drivers
PESHAWAR: Three activists of Pakistan Tehrik-i-Insaf (PTI) were arrested for their alleged involvement in manhandling truck drivers carrying Nato supplies to Afghanistan near Hayatabad Toll Plaza on Friday.

A private TV channel reported that PTI's District General Secretary Younas Zaheer confirmed the arrest and said the workers were arrested after the party's seventh sit-in in a row blocking Nato supplies in protest against the US drone attacks.

He demanded of police to forthwith release the workers as "they were protesting against the US drone strikes that killed many innocents and sabotaged the peace process in Pakistan."

It is pertinent to mention that Provincial Police Chief Nasir Durrani has ordered the police to prevent protesters from stopping trucks.

The Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) police also registered cases against 35 PTI activists for manhandling truck drivers. Some 100 PTI protesters reportedly checked shipment documents of trucks, heading to Afghanistan, at the Hayatabad toll booth and also manhandled some drivers.

The cases have been registered against the accused involved in thrashing drivers under Sections 141, 148, 149 and 341 PPC on orders of IG KP at the Pishta Khara Police Station.

thuggee, ٹھگ

A photograph of a group of elderly men sitting on a mat, taken in Peshawar, now in Pakistan, circa 1865. Two of the men are looking at each other with contempt, suggesting that they may actually be enemies who have been persuaded to be photographed together as examples of native "thugs." 

ٹھگ
A DARK CHAPTER FROM MUGHAL/COLONIAL ERA HISTORY

THUGS,also known as tuggee refers to the acts of thugs, an organized gang of professional assassins.
They were first mentioned in the Ẓiyāʾ-ud-Dīn Baranī (English: History of Fīrūz Shāh) dated around 1356.
The Thugs would join travelers and gain their confidence. This would allow them to then surprise and strangle their victims by pulling a handkerchief or noose tight around their necks. They would then rob their victims of valuables and bury their bodies. This led them to also be called Phansigar .
In the 1830s they were targeted for eradication by William Bentinck and his chief captain William Henry Sleeman. They were seemingly destroyed by this effort.

H-4 is a guided bomb integrated into PAF JF-17 Arsenal. 
The bomb can be dropped 120 Km away from the target,keeping the aircraft out of harms way.
The bomb has its own rocket motor,sensors and wings.
It can travel 120 Km to the target and hit the target with great accuracy due to it's terminal guidance sensors.

The bomb was intitially procured from South Africa as H-2 Raptor-1 with 60Km range.
Later Pakistan's own NESCOM improved upon the system and created their own version the H-4 with 124 Km range.

THE LEGENDARY GAMA OF LAHORE

 He used to do five thousand bethaks (squats) and three thousand dands (pushups)
Gama's daily training, which in maturity consisted of grappling with forty of his fellow wrestlers in the court.
The "Great" Gama (c. 1880 – May 22, 1963) also known as "Gama Pahelvan" (Urdu: گاما پھلوان) born Ghulam Muhammad (Urdu: غلام محمد).He was one of the Greatest Wrestlers of South Asia,Undefeated his whole life which was substantial, as his career had spanned more than 50 years.

He lifted a 1200 kg stone at the age of 22 at Baroda and the stone is kept for display at Baroda Museum in Sayajibaug and it is two-and-a-half feet in height and has text inscribed on it.

Security forces foil suicide attack on Islamabad Imambargah 

A suicide bombing attempt was foiled in Islamabad and the alleged suicide bomber and mastermind were arrested, Express News reported on Thursday.

According to initial reports, they were planning to attack the Imambargah in Sector G-6, Islamabad on Muharram 9, but security forces foiled the attack by arresting them the night before.

Police also seized suicide jackets and other equipment from them.

The alleged suicide bomber and the mastermind behind the attack were identified as Muhammad Saeed Abdullah and Matiullah.

It is reported that Matiullah is an Afghani citizen and was issued a Pakistani visa on October 20. He had visited Pakistan before multiple times and was deported back to Afghanistan when he was found involved in issuing fake visas.

The Future of Navy

In November 2001, the U.S. Navy unveiled a family of three ship designs constituting its Future Surface Combatant Program. Of them, one, the CG(X) air- and ballistic-missile-defense cruiser, was canceled. The second, the small surface combatant later dubbed the Littoral Combat Ship (LCS), has been subjected to withering scrutiny—including, on occasion, from your humble scribe. Yet the third, the DD(X) guided-missile destroyer (DDG)—subsequently redesignated —has generated far less heat. To all appearances, the DDG-1000 marks as radical a break as does the LCS from traditional ship designs—maybe more so. Why, then, have the two programs fared so differently in the public eye?

First of all, a straightforward narrative explains the Zumwalts' purposes. For all its bizarre appearance—its low-slung profile, tapering "tumblehome" hull, and pyramid-like superstructure misled a friend into pronouncing it a "cool sub!"—the DDG-1000 remains a familiar ship type, meant to perform a familiar slate of missions. The U.S. Navy has operated DDGs since the advent of shipboard guided missiles in the 1950s. DDGs can be oriented more toward fleet air and ballistic-missile defense, like the workhorse DDG-51 Arleigh Burke class, or more toward shore fire support, like the Zumwalts. These are differences of emphasis, not of kind. Well-defined missions simplify naval officials' messaging and branding efforts.

Pakistan boxing strikes gold after 66 years 

Pakistan has become the newest member of the World Boxing Council (WBC), where the country will be represented in the professional circuit for the first time.

Up until now, the Pakistan Boxing Federation (PBF) had been affiliated with the International Amateur Boxing Association. However, a Pakistan delegation from the newly formed Pakistan Professional Boxing League (PPBL) is participating for the first time in history in the ongoing 51st World Boxing Council Convention in Thailand.

PPBL Chief Operating Officer Umer stated "It is a big step for Pakistan boxing because this is the first time our country will be part of the professional circuit after 66 years of our existence as a nation," 

"The formation of the league means that we can hold international professional boxing events in Pakistan."

Pakistani scholar wins 'Young Researcher of the Year Award 2013' 

Dr. Muhammad Ehsan Khan, a young PhD scholar from Pakistan, has won 'Young Researcher of the Year Award-2013' by International Project Management Association (IPMA), Switzerland.

IPMA is the first Project management association as well as the leading global authority on Project Programme and Portfolio Management, and the IPMA's Award is the most sought-after accolade awarded only to individuals with distinguished and cutting edge research in the field of Project Management and Governance.

Dr. Khan is also the first Muslim and Pakistani awarded with the James Snyder Award by the Project Management Institute (PMI) in 2012. He is also the second Pakistani to be accredited with Program Management Professional (PgMP) certification in 2010.

See more: http://www.pakistanaffairs.pk/threads/60422-Pakistani-scholar-wins-%E2%80%98Young-Researcher-of-the-Year-Award-2013%E2%80%99?p=185151#post185151

Pakistan and china Join hands to set up Truck manufacturing plant in Pakistan.


NLC, HIT, NORINCO China sign Agreement for Indigenous Assembly Trucks

The three giants, National Logistics Cell(NLC), Heavy Industries Taxila (HIT), and China North Industries Corporation Limited (NORINCO China) joined hands in an impressive Joint venture agreement signing ceremony for establishment of truck assembly plant at HIT Taxila, which is likely to start production within a year. The Plant will initially assemble 300 units of Euro compliant trucks and prime movers of various categories and will be scalable in production output as per market demand.

The Joint Venture Agreement was signed by Quarter Master General who is also Officer Incharge NLC Lieutenant General Sajjad Ghani, Chairman HIT Lieutenant General Syed Wajid Hussain and Senior Vice President NORINCO Mr. Wang Lee. H.E Mr. Sun Weidong Ambassador Peoples Republic of China, Director General NLC Major General Asghar Nawaz and other senior officials attended the signing ceremony.

The trucks will be assembled by a Joint Private Limited Company PAKNOR with brand name of Power Star. Product quality will be ensured by NORINCO, who will train the HR to manufacture and assemble top quality products. The availability of technicians by NORINCO will facilitate production programme in Pakistan. The most significant aspect of the Project would be on transfer of technology basis that will not only bring foreign investment but it will also build capacity of local technicians and create employment opportunities in the industry.

NORINCO is already engaged in Defense production with HIT since long. The plant will also provide an opportunity to HIT for diversification in many respects and NLC will be the major buyer of the prime movers to modernize its fleet. This can be regarded as a major development to boost the indigenous truck production industry of Pakistan and will go a long way in the revival efforts of national economy.
http://www.pakistanaffairs.pk/threads/60282-Pakistan-China-sign-Agreement-for-Indigenous-Assembly-Trucks

Pakistan Army Aviation Corps

All Pakistan's Cobra helicopters have head-up display, a laser rangefinder, an infrared jammer mounted above the engine exhaust, and an infrared suppressing engine exhaust system, and the M143 Air Data Subsystem (ADS).

The helicopters have pilot's M76 Head-Up Display (HUD), M136 Helmet Sight Subsystem (HSS), laser rangefinder and tracker, and M26 Fire Control Computer (FCC). An M143 Air Data Subsystem (ADS). The installation of the M147 Rocket Management Subsystem (RMS) permitted use of the standard 2.75 inch rocket system, in addition to the M65 TOW/Cobra missile system, and the M197 20mm gun on the new M97A2 universal turret.
The gunship's M197 Gattling Gun can fire 730 Rounds per minute.

Enabling the poor: Pakistan ranks 3rd in favourable microfinance environment 

Pakistan has the third-best microfinance business environment in the world, according to The Economist Intelligence Unit's analysis of the microfinance business environment in 55 countries.

In its recently released report titled "Global microscope on the microfinance business environment 2013," the business information arm of The Economist Group puts Pakistan after Peru and Bolivia on the overall microfinance business environment ranking.

"Pakistan… is considered to have one of the most enabling environments for microfinance regionally and globally," said the report, which ranks countries on the basis of two broad categories: Regulatory Framework and Practices, which examines regulatory and market-entry conditions; and Supporting Institutional Framework, which assesses business practices and client interaction.

Chief of Army Staff General Kayani to retire confirmed

Chief of Army Staff General Ashfaq Parvez Kayani decided to retire from his post. Kayani will step down on November 29 as army chief after serving twice the normal three-year term for the position.

The Inter Services Public Relations issued a press release announcing his decision to retire. Kayani in the press release said that he has no intention of extending his tenure as COAS.

Aiming to dispel rumors of his move to occupy a new, powerful position, the army chief said, "For quite sometime, my current responsibilities and likely future plans have been debated in the media with all sorts of rumours and speculations doing the rounds. The subject of being entrusted with new duties has also come up in several reports. I am grateful to the political leadership and the nation for reposing their trust in me and Pakistan Army at this important juncture of our national history. However, I share the general opinion that institutions and traditions are stronger than individuals and must take precedence."

How to help Balochistan Earthquake victims

Besides sending cash through below mentioned charity organizations, you can support by providing following commodities. Please do not donate old/expired stuff. Make sure edible items are hygienic and properly packed.

- Clothing: Clothes of various sizes, Beddings, Shoes
- Utensils: Jerricans (large plastic cans that hold 20 liters of water or other liquids), Crockery, Buckets
- Toiletries: Tissues, Soaps, Dettol (antibacterial cleaners), Towels
- Food: Rice, Sugar, Flour (Atta), Onions, Potatoes, Cooking oil, Tea, Milk (tetra packs or powder), Safe drinking water, Cooked Food

Medicines:

1. Water purification tablets.
2. Life saving drugs.
3. Vaccines for malaria, cholera, typhoid, influenza.
4. Pain killers including strong ones like morphine derivatives, tremadol, pethadine, kinz .
5. Antibiotics e.g. tetnus, amoxil, gentamycin.
6. IV cannulas
7. IV Drip sets
8. IV drips: normal saline, ringerlactate
9. Local anesthetics (injections)
10. Cotton bandages, cotton.
11. Surgical instruments: e.g needle holders, forceps, tweezers.
12. Suturing materials, Skin staples.

INS Khukri was sunk by PNS HANGOR on 9 Dec 1971

During 1971 Indo-Pak war, the burden of Pakistan Navy's offensive effort hinged on the small but effective submarine force. PN Submarine HANGOR sailed in the early hours of 22 November 1971 to patrol off the Indian Kathiawar coast under the command of Commander Ahmed Tasnim S.J

On 9 Dec, in an effort to locate the evasive enemy, HANGOR extended her patrol northward to investigate some radio transmissions intercepted on her sensors. Two contacts were picked up on passive sonar and were identified as warships. The initial range was 6 to 8 miles. A pursuit of the enemy began but the first attempt to attack these ships failed due to speed disadvantage. The submarine however managed to forecast target ships movement and succeeded in taking up a tactically advantageous position on the path of the patrolling frigates by 1900. At 1957 the submarine fired a down the throat shot with a homing torpedo at the northerly ship from a depth of 40 meters.

read the rest: http://www.pakistanaffairs.pk/threads/9540-INS-Khukri-was-sunk-by-PNS-HANGOR-on-9-Dec-1971-41-yrs-back

UNIDO promotes biomass gasification in Pakistan 

Power generation from biomass gasification could help meet a significant portion of Pakistan's industrial energy needs, Federal Minister of Information, Senator Pervez Rasheed, said on Friday.

Rasheed was speaking as the chief guest at the inception workshop of a new project for promotion of biomass gasification technology by the United Nations Industrial Development Organisation (Unido).

The four-year "Promoting Sustainable Energy Production and Use from Biomass in Pakistan" project is funded by $1.82 million from the Global Environment Facility – an international institution that provides grants for environment-related projects.

Another $5.3 million will be provided by Unido, Small and Medium Enterprises Development Authority (Smeda), Pakistan Poverty Alleviation Fund (PPAF), Sindh Agriculture and Forestry Workers Coordinating Organisation (SAFWCO), Centre for Energy Systems at the National University of Sciences and Technology (CES-NUST) and other entities from the Pakistani private sector.

Hyderabad 1948: India's hidden massacre 

When India was partitioned in 1947 about 500,000 people died in communal rioting, mainly along the borders with Pakistan. But a year later another massacre occurred in central India, which until now has remained clouded in secrecy.

In September and October 1948, soon after independence from the British Empire, tens of thousands of people were brutally slaughtered in central India.

Some were lined up and shot by Indian Army soldiers. Yet a government-commissioned report into what happened was never published and few in India know about the massacre. Critics have accused successive Indian governments of an ongoing cover-up.

Pakistan's New Big Threat Isn't Terrorism—It's Water

In a report released last week by the Asian Development Bank (ADB), Pakistan was pinpointed as "one of the most water-stressed countries in the world, not far from being classified, 'water-scarce'." As water demand exceeds supply in the South Asian country, more and more water is being withdrawn from the nation's reservoirs, leaving them in a critically precarious position. According to the ADB, Pakistan's storage capacity, the amount of water it has on reserve in case of an emergency, is limited to a 30-day supply -- far below the recommended 1,000 days for countries with similar climates. Without meaningful action, a water crisis could push the country into further chaos.

KARACHI: In order to avoid massive traffic gridlocks this Ramazan, residents of Karachi can now adjust their radio frequency to FM 88.6 and decide what route would be best suited to their destination.

The Sindh Traffic Police started the test transmission of its own FM radio station on July 9 and plans to run it for at least three weeks. The Pakistan Navy: A Transformation from 'Fledgling Force' to' a Fighting Machine'

The Pakistan navy (PN) is poised on the brink of a transformation. Neglected for long by Pakistan's political masters and a dominant Pakistan army, the PN was unable to assert its salience and witnessed slow growth. But in the one decade since the September 2001 attacks and the US led 'war on terror', it has undergone a striking metamorphosis. As Pakistan realises the importance of having a robust maritime force and commits greater resources for its development, the tactics of the PN and its broader strategy in the northern Arabian Sea too have undergone a shift. An enhanced international profile and greater credibility for its role in regional maritime order is gradually resulting in the PN becoming a more confident and assertive player, and a major stakeholder in the regional maritime security regime.

Dr. Ruth Pfau A German lady who dedicated her entire life for the people of Pakistan She is  Pakistan's Mother Teresa  she is 80 y old now live in Pakistan

Dr. Ruth Katherina Martha Pfau[1] NQA, HPk, HI (born 1929) is a German[2] nun and a member of the Society of Daughters of the Heart of Mary who has devoted the last 50 years of life to fighting leprosy in Pakistan. In 1996, Pakistan was declared by the World Health Organization to have controlled leprosy, one of the first countries in Asia to achieve this goal

Dr. Pfau was born in Leipzig, Germany in 1929.

In 1960 Ruth decided to dedicate the rest of her life to the people of Pakistan and their battle against Leprosy outbreaks. She came to Karachi and visited a leprosy colony on McLeod Road behind the City Railway Station.

Here she decided that the care of patients would be her life's calling. She started with medical treatment for the Leprosy patients in a hut in this slumquarter.

Dr. Pfau went to the far off areas of Pakistan where there were no medical facilities for leprosy patients. She collected donations in Germany and Pakistan and cooperated with hospitals in Rawalpindi and Karachi.

Ruth Pfau is recognised in Pakistan and abroad as a distinguished human being and has been awarded many prizes and medals. Sister Ruth Pfau was among recipients of civilian awards at President's House on Pakistan Day 23 March 1989. Sister Pfau received the Hilal-i-Pakistan award for her work with leprosy patients. Pakistan's military is all set to adopt a "new concept" of war for fighting future conventional threats, specifically pre-empting India's cold-start military doctrine, revealed security officials. The new war concept, developed after four years of war games and military exercises, seeks to improve the mobilisation time of troops and develop an integrated response from the combined fighting arms of the army, navy and air forces, in case of a conventional military threat.

It will formally be put into practice with the culmination of the "Azm-e-Nou" war-games series this month. The exercises, which started in 2009, have been part of the army's new concept of war fighting, designed to respond to the threat posed by India's Pakistan-specific cold-start doctrine.

Two-child policy violates human rights of Myanmar's Rohingya Muslims – UN expert

An independent United Nations human rights expert today urged the Government of Myanmar to respond unequivocally to the revival of a local order limiting the number of children Rohingya Muslims can have to two, stressing that this is a clear violation of their human rights.

Tomás Ojea Quintana, the Special Rapporteur on the human rights situation in Myanmar emphasized that the Government had an obligation to review and revoke all orders which violate international human rights standards.

"This local order is one of many that have been introduced by local Rakhine state authorities that violate the basic human rights of Rohingya Muslims, including with regard to freedom of movement, marriage, and registration of newborn children."

"These orders provide further ammunition to local authorities, including the border security force Nasaka, to discriminate against and persecute the most vulnerable and marginalized group in Myanmar," he added in a news release.

Mr. Ojea Quintana noted that the vast majority of the 800,000 Rohingya Muslims are without citizenship and are stateless, making them extremely vulnerable to human rights violations.

PTI received second most votes in general election 

Imran Khan' party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI), despite finishing third in terms of seats, received the second largest number of votes in the general election, data released on Monday showed.

PTI polled 7.7 million votes in the general election to win 28 National Assembly seats, but Pakistan People's Party (PPP), which led the outgoing government, took 32 seats with only 6.9 million ballots.
Turnout at the election, which marked the first time a civilian government had completed a five-year term and handed over power at the ballot box, was 55 per cent, the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) said – up from 44 per cent in the 2008 poll.
In total, 46.2 million people voted compared with 36.6 million five years ago, despite Taliban threats to attack polling stations on election day.

Both PTI and PPP were well behind Pakistan Muslim League-N (PML-N), led by two-time prime minister Nawaz Sharif, which took 126 seats having received 14.9 million votes, according to the ECP.
